fields.description: These could then be easily referrenced to in the review summary.
fields.summary: It would be useful if defects could be automatically given unique IDs

fields.description:
Changeset C1 contains commit for file A version 1.2
Changeset C2 contains commit for file A version 1.3

Selecting C1 will include changes 1.1 -> 1.2 of file A, and the box next the the file in the changeset list is ticked.
Selecting C2 will update the diff to 1.1 -> 1.3 and the file in C2 will be ticked, but crucible will also deselect the tick next to the file in changeset C1.

It would be much more useful and less confusing if the tick on C2 remained....after all, the code changes that were committed for C1 are still included in the review.
fields.summary: When selecting files from changsets where the file is already in a review, Crucible unticks the box for that file in the other changesets

fields.description:
When selecting CVS changesets in reverse chronological order the versions to diff are not selected correctly:

changeset C1 commits file F1 at version 1.3
changeset C2 commits file F1 at version 1.4

Selecting changeset C2 correctly select diffs 1.3 - 1.4
selecting C1 afterwards results in message saying change is already included, and does not update the versions in the diff.
The correct thing to do would be to update the change diff to 1.2 - 1.4
fields.summary: Versions to diff are not always correctly selected when selecting multiple changesets.

fields.description:
We don't want our developers to select who is the author or moderator of a review, but if we restrict editing to the review details, they cannot edit the review title.

It would be good if modification of the review title and the review roles were controlled by different settings in the permission schema.
fields.summary: Allow a user to add a title to a new review without also being able to change the project, moderator or author.

fields.description:
The new project page is very slow due to calculating metrics. The queries need to be optimized in the same way the original dashboard was.

Caching is probably warranted, however given that it will be regularly invalidated by changes, the underlying queries still need to be more efficient than they are.
fields.summary: Optimize chart queries

fields.description:
Apparently these are customisable, but the defaults really suck. Currently, looks like this:

* Missing
* Extra (superfluous)
* Ambiguous
* Inconsistent
* Improvement desirable
* Not conforming to standards
* Risk-prone
* Factually incorrect
* Not implementable
* Editorial

Wow, that reads like something out of a 1960s research paper. Oh, hang on... :)

A few of them could stay, in my opinion, but perhaps reworded a bit:

* Inconsistency (noun form is better)
* Could be improved (reworded)
* Not conforming to standards

Some classifications I'd be more likely to use for defects:

- Potential bug
- Unexpected side-effects
- Localisation
- Usability
- Performance
- Documentation

I'm sure you guys can come up with some more. Have a think next time you're classifying a defect. I can almost never find one in the default list that matches what I'm thinking.
fields.summary: Better default defect classifications

fields.description: We should be able to hide projects entirely from sets of users.
fields.summary: Add ability to secure projects, rather than just the reviews within them

fields.description:
GET /reviews-v1/review-items will return a list of ReviewItemData instances

Janusz, please review and assign back to me
fields.summary: Add REST method to retrieve review items for a given review

fields.description: This allows the implementation of https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-30
fields.summary: Add REST method to retrieve all reviews which involve a given file

fields.description:
These features will allow https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PL-34 to be implemented.

- expose addReviewer
- expose addFisheyeDiff
- add 'addRevision' function -- What are the requirements for this?

I've assigned this to Janusz for clarification of addRevision -- please assign it back to me after you've added that.
fields.summary: Add REST methods to allow review creation

fields.description:
ideas:
- where we display TITLE in the review page, change that to PROJECNAME -> TITLE
- need a "list of projects" somewhere, on dahsboard, or linked from dashboard (ie /cru/browse shows list of projects)
- also on the root page
fields.summary: link to project page
"Allow anyone to join" option to be ON by default and uneditable

fields.description:
Crucible should accept uploads of files, either for review standalone or that can be diff'd to source in a known repository. 

Tools like ThePlugin have a role to play in linking the arbitrary file with the previous revision.
fields.summary: Upload files for review (not patches)

fields.description:
Where it's possible to match the diff from revision in a patch to a repository, Crucible should support full context diff options (and link to the full source of the previous rev). 

Additionally, it would be great if a patch review could be manually (or indeed automatically) linked to a change _after_ it was commited.
fields.summary: link patches to scm revisions

fields.description: When viewing anonymously, the stats in the 'Everyone's Reviews' widget on the dashboard show incorrect numbers, as if it is counting all reviews (not just ones that anon folks can view).
fields.summary: Review Stats In Dashboard Widget Aren't Right (with permissions hiding some reviews)

fields.description: Now that I've figured out how to get our review scheme viewable by anon folks, we need some way to mark specific reviews within the project as being not-anon.  Rather than having to setup a whole new permission scheme & project, and forcing people to choose the project every time they create a review... the review creator should be able to modify the permision scheme of a review (while keeping it in the same project, for stats & email filters & all that).
fields.summary: Add Per Review Security Level, Like JIRA

fields.description:
The RpcAuthHelper class doesn't seem to correctly validate a token which has been previously generated via a call to the login method of the Auth web service.  

Upon further inspection, it appears that the LoginCookie instance created within the RpcAuthHelper class is constructed using a url of '/services'.  Since calls to the Review web service use a url of '/service/review', the matches() method of LoginCookie returns false.  I've attached a copy of RpcAuthHelper that seems to fix the problem.
fields.summary: Review web services don't correctly validate token

There seem to be a few security holes when it comes to 'hiding' a project.  Whilst reviews are hidden in the main search results, the count on the right still counts the hidden reviews.

Also the RSS feed still shows the review details.

fields.description:
When selecting the files (or rather versions thereof) for review, there is no easy way to select the versions that changed between two changesets (Subversion revisions)? 

Using the search tab in review creation and doing a search that results in what you want is not straight forward with SVN revisions.

Example: 
Need to review changes between Rev20 (on PROD now) and Rev32 (candidate release) yet development already started on the next release and we're up to Rev34. 
I don't want to include changes made between Rev32 and Rev34.
fields.summary: Make it more easy to select SVN versions for review

fields.description: see screenshot, it prints "project" when it should be the project's actual name
fields.summary: "project project" in Permission Screen in admin

fields.description:
An error pop-up appears intermittently when viewing a review or navigating through review comments and diffs. The error message even appears on an idle screen (without performing any operations). It seems to only occur with reviews that are based on a patch file. 

The error is:
{quote}
The reported problem was:
AnnotatorTag
 
You are running release CR1.2.2 FE1.4.2 (build-268 2008-01-14), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
 
Got a problem or a suggestion? Discuss it in the online forums see the website for other support options.
{quote}

I have also attached the exception that shows up in the logs when the error occurs.

The issue prevents users from viewing or modifying the review since the only options after the error is to reload the review or close the pop-up.  The error still appears even after reloading or logging out completely.
fields.summary: AnnotatorTag error: Could not get blame for file

fields.description:
currently, notification email subjects are not customisable. Since the change to use freemarker templates with notification email, there exists a way to allow email subject customisation in the email template. 

The suggested model is to allow the subject be specified on the first line of the email template, after the [#ftl] tag, beginning with the string "Subject: " , e.g., 
{code}[#ftl]
Subject: ${comment.user.displayName} commented in ${review.permaId}       [#-- this is the subject line --]

[#if comment?exists]
    [@compress single_line=true]
    ${review.permaId}
    [#if comment.defectRaised]
        ${comment.user.displayName} raised a defect
    [#else]
        commented
    [/#if]{code}
If the subject line doesn't exist, the default subject is used.
fields.summary: let the subject of the email be modifiable via the notification template

fields.description:
I am evaluating Crucible email notification feature.
I want to know if we can customize the tent of Email notification.
For exmaple, after creator create a new review, reviewers will receive an email notification,
we want to add some content for all reviews, let the reviewers know what they should use Atlassian Crucible review and complete the review. And different content for moderators what to do.
fields.summary: How to customize the email notification content

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to do this effectively is to add everyone in the system to a single "everyone" group, and then put that group into the project as "Allowed Review Participants".

There is no way that I can find in the permissions schemes to allow all logged in users to be Moderator/Author, and those combo boxes are only populated by the people we explicitly add to the allowed review participants area.

We want the ability to either:

A) Specify all logged in users can be moderator/author in project reviews

B) Bulk edit group membership

C) Automatically add users to a group when their account is created

Really the best solution for this specific problem is "A", but bulk editing group membership is a basic feature that needs to be included in any product that uses user/group based permissions.
fields.summary: Allow all users to be able to a "Moderator" or "Author" in a review project

fields.description:
Crucibel is now started and stopped using bat-files, there are a couple problems with this:
* Crucible does not automatically start when the machine restarts, like after running WIndows Update 
* There is no graceful shutdown of Crucible when the machine shutdowns

Having a Windows Service control the starting and stopping of Crucible (as it is for Jira) would be a vast improvement.
fields.summary: Improve the starting and stopping of Crucible

fields.description: When doing a code review, you can check off files as you review them to keep track of which files you already reviewed vs. did not review.  If you have checked off files and then click on "download raw text" icon you navigate to a new page, and going back to the review the history of which files you had checked off is lost.  It would be nice if this could instead be retained.  Or, is there an alternative way a review should be conducted to achieve this functionality?
fields.summary: Check boxes for checking off files reviewed in a review are lost if navigate to raw text by "download raw text" icon

fields.description: User lists unsorted when Allowed Participants restricted by Group. Affects widgets and dropdowns.
fields.summary: Users lists unsorted when Allowed Participants restricted by Group

fields.description: Review a 3500 line file is very slow. Clicking on a line takes about 30 - 45 seconds to show a comment block. The service is running on my machine.
fields.summary: Very Slow Performance on large source files.

fields.description: I would like to have a 'First Change' and 'Next Change' (or only Next Change / Previous Change) buttons on the diff screen. Currently viewing diffs on large files is hard, becasue I have to manually scan for changes (using full source because I need a lot of context.)
fields.summary: First Change and Next Change Buttons

fields.description:
Currently a lot of log information does not include enough meaningful information (e.g. affected repository name).
Also fisheye.out output could be laid out much better (e.g. to contain timestamps).
fields.summary: Improve accuracy and relevancy of information in log files - improve supportability of Crucible + FishEye

fields.description:
In general, it seems like a Fisheye issue, but it's a formally Crucible+Fisheye bundle, therefore I'm reporting it as Crucible bug.

Crucible is running nicely for 1-2 days, than one of the jvm process that it runs on starts consuming 100% of processor time. I have logs supressed to error messages only and have many tracebacks like below in it (pointing to different spots in repository in actual error message)

fields.description:
It would be good if Crucible was able to send trackback notifications for any URLs included in code reviews.

In particular, this would be great for JIRA issues referenced by a review. This would be a neat way for the JIRA issue to automagically refer back to related code reviews.
fields.summary: Add outbound trackback support (for JIRA issues)

fields.description:
Hello,

Our customer reported that source code review comments in Japanese are not handled correctly by Crucible. Could you make sure UTF-8 encoding is fully supported by the application?

regards,

Neeraj
fields.summary: Accept review comments in Japanese (unicode characters)

fields.description: The subject line for notifications from Crucible (and FishEye too) is not configurable. It would be nice to be able to customize this.
fields.summary: Configurable email subject line

fields.description:
If a file is under review, and a newer revision is committed, then this should be indicated to any reviewers by flagging it in the UI.
Also provide a link to the new revision, or the diffs.
fields.summary: Flag files which have been modified since a review was created

fields.description:
This prevents linking to Javadoc, with a link like:

http://commons.apache.org/collections/api-3.1/org/apache/commons/collections/list/PredicatedList.html#decorate(java.util.List,%20org.apache.commons.collections.Predicate)

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Parentheses should be valid URL characters

fields.description:
In configuration and UI interface it should be possible to specify more than one address on which web server will bind. Currently it's possible to specify only one address.

This would require config.xml to support multiple webserver elements. Also UI should include support for multiple bind addresses.

As a result I should be able to setup the same server to listen to i.e. 123.23.21.2:8023 and 123.34.23.4:8024 at the same time.
fields.summary: Add to server support for binding on multiple addresses

fields.description:
A user pointed out today that when you add the results of a search to a review you get diffs when most of the time you want full source. They wanted to add a whole tag to a review, when they search for a tag and add the results they get a bunch of empty diffs.

The default, for the search tab at least (and probably the file tab as well), should be to add the revision without a diff. An option to add a guessed (or specific) diff would be good too.
fields.summary: Add revisions not diffs to a review

fields.description: in some situations, a backup occuring during an incremental scan will cause a failure in the incremental scan
fields.summary: race condition between crucible backup and repository scan
Add RPC call to create review from patch

fields.description:
The dates in the "My Reviews" RSS feed are do not appear in a consistent format. The month and day parts of the date are swapped when the day is 1-12.
This does not occur in other feeds such as "All Reviews". Microsoft Outlook is being used to read the RSS feeds.
fields.summary: Incorrect dates in RSS feeds

fields.description: When I click on a checkbox to add a new revision to an existing review, it spins forever. I don't think that all reviews have this problem, but I'm not sure what exact circumstances lead to this state. I looked at the ajax transaction in firebug, but it didn't look particularly interesting. It did at least have a response, but it just looked like a standard java stackdump in its body.
fields.summary: Checking box in "manage files" -> "changesets" spins forever

fields.description:
I finished a review and I was prompted with a list of comments that were still in DRAFT state.

They all had the POST links down the right hand side.

I click one and nothing happened, so I clicked it again.  It acted on the first click and POSTed it, then moved the buttons so that DELETE now under my mouse.  The second click was then executed and the comment was delete with no confirmation and no way to return.  It was my only good comment on the entire review and its gone gone.

Maybe a confirmation or some ajax wizardry when i post so they all gray out while its busy ajaxing my post request?
fields.summary: Finalizing a comments Leads to Accidental Deletion

fields.description: Change ant build file so that it can pass to JUnit tests Java (system) properties defining full path to Perforce executables
fields.summary: Perforce unit tests do not work on Windows platform

fields.description: The "open in new tab" feature is completely useless since when you click back on the review tab, the new tab goes away. In my mind, the whole point of tabs is so that you can conveniently keep multiple contexts open and quickly switch back and forth between them.
fields.summary: File tabs should be kept open

fields.description: When defining the review, I can pick the files I want, then under "Manage files" I can select what the lower revision number is. Frequently, however, I find I have not selected the most recent diff in the file selection process, so I have to delete the diff and reselect with a newer revision. Is it possible to allow both diff revisions to be changed? I.e., if I pick rev 1.5 it automatically assumes I'm comparing 1.5 to 1.4, and I can choose instead to compare 1.5 to 1.3, 1.2, 1.1, or no diff. But if I really wanted 1.7, I have to entirely reselect the file, instead of being able to change to 1.7.
fields.summary: Allow both diff revisions to be changed in review tab - change diff button

fields.description: My staff consistently forget to "Approve" a review, thinking that doing so will close the review. I'd highly recommend changing or expanding the term. Perhaps "Open for review", or "Approve and begin review". Also, moving that button into the orange "Draft" box will make it more obvious what the next step is. Its current placement is somewhat subtle, given everything else on the screen.
fields.summary: Changing or expanding the term - 'Approve'

fields.description: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/FECRU/2008/01/24/A+jar+audit+between+Crucible+1.2.2+and+1.3
fields.summary: Address all issues outline here

fields.description: It would be sweet if we could implement the equivalent of a post-commit hook for integrating with other software when a review is completed. The example I'm thinking of is posting issue tracker comments to all linked cases. If the hook interface simply provided the review number and a list of changesets / file revisions, you could leave it up to the hook to figure out the case linking. I realize that you don't necessarily want to enable Jira competition, but it would be really nice if Crucible could integrate with other bug trackers as well. Jira isn't what we chose for good reasons, and we'd still like to use fisheye / crucible in a well-integrated fashion.
fields.summary: Generic SW Integration Hooks

fields.description:
I've linked cr-10 to cr-9.
If I try to use cr-9's "link a review" input to link to cr-10, I get an error message "review cr-9 doesn't exist". I agree this is an error, but that's not the right text.
fields.summary: Crucible allows circular review linking and can't delete a review link

fields.description:
It would be really nice if reviews could be assigned due dates. There would need to be nag emails and a few simple configurations:
- A default review length (possibly configurable per project), which when sent would auto-assign a due date N days after a review is started
- Ability to configure whether nag emails are sent after the review completion
- Ability to configure whether nag emails are sent within N days of the review completion
fields.summary: Reviews should have optional due dates

fields.description:
The process for creating patch reviews is overly cumbersome, as described in [Creating a Patch Review|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/2.1.7+Creating+a+Patch+Review]. This process is particularly painful for Perforce users.

There is a note at the bottom of the linked page that says "A future version of Crucible will include helper tools to assist in this process" but separate communications with Atlassian indicate there is no ETA for the helper tools. An ETA would be nice to have. :-)

For Perforce users, it would be nice if the patch helper tools would automate the process of creating a patch for a specified Perforce changelist, including files added or deleted. If the patch could be automatically linked to a review, perhaps via a Crucible SPI, that would be ideal.
fields.summary: Helper tools needed to smooth the process for creating patch reviews

fields.description:
Attempting to delete a project results in an error. I tried abandoning all reviews in the project first and it did not make a difference. According to Crucible, there were no reviews at all associated with these projects anymore.

Error Message
---------------------

Error in the Administration Application

An error has occurred in the Fisheye Administration Application.

You are running release 1.4.1 (build-263 2007-12-19), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

The following Error was reported:
Project still contains projects.
fields.summary: Cannot delete projects

fields.description: It shouldn't say "New Review (Select Changes", it should probably say "Active Review (Select Changes)", or something similar.
fields.summary: Title wrong for post-approval in manage files tab

fields.description: I find the lack of change history on a code review a bit disturbing. It seems that there does need to be a history log of field changes, file / revision / patch changes, and revision range changes, all in-line with comments / defects, so that as new revisions are added, the comments fit in with the history. It should be made clear which comments / defects were made against which revision diffs, as fixes are made in new revisions and the new revisions are added to the diff range.
fields.summary: Code Reviews need history logs for auditing - ala Jira case history

fields.description: When a defect has been noted in a review, it would be nice if the author could add files / revisions to correct the defects, and the defect authors could mark the defects as being resolved. It seems that the current workflow requires completing the review with defects, then creating a new review (optionally linked to the original) for the resolution of the defects.
fields.summary: Reviews should allow for updating of files
Dashboard should have a category to list defective reviews
Filtering needs to include whether a review had defects

fields.description: It seems very strange to me that the top-level view of reviews in the dashboard lists don't have any kind of indication whether the review was successful. Given the current functionality of crucible, that would have to be a number of defects.
fields.summary: Review listings should show number of defects

fields.description:
When I select summarize and then view a comment, the premalink link does not work. It produces a link to the summarize page which cannot be accessed by others.
I expect a link to the comment that can be viewed by anyone.
fields.summary: permalink for a comment does not work when summarize mode is active

fields.description:
We would like to clean up our repository: prune all projects that have been completed. We would like to delete the projects but currently we are unable to.

Archival and/or Deletion of a project would be a very nice feature for us.
fields.summary: Able to archive and/or delete a project together with reviews in it

fields.description: Crowd has a special attribute 'requiresPasswordChange' which when set to 'true' can be used by integrated applications to initiate a change password workflow.
fields.summary: Implement the Crowd 'requiresPasswordChange' attribute upon login.

fields.description:
Create a project dashboard page that sits at a URL like /cru/projectkey

- Link to project sysadmin edit page
- List project details
- List reviews that belong to that project similar to personal dashboards
- reports area, say right hand side
- allow for pluggable reports
fields.summary: Create Project Dashboard page

fields.description:
This is a parent issue for "proper" JIRA integration tasks

Feature ideas:

* Manually and/or automatically create new JIRAs from one or more review comments
* Link a review to a JIRA 
* Control issue state from Crucible (e.g. close the jira when closing the review)
* Associate existing JIRAs with comments/reviews
* Display associated JIRA info in Crucible (e.g. overlay)
fields.summary: JIRA Integration

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to open one or more new JIRA issues as part of a Crucible code review
fields.summary: Create JIRA issues from code reviews

fields.description:
Currently if a project is Crucible is set to have a default repository mapped, it still asks the user to specify which project they wish to create the review under.  This is to accommodate the scenario in which multiple projects are mapped to the same repository.

If there is only one Crucible project mapped to a given repository, when creating a review out of that repository, rather than asking the user to confirm the project, it should force the default mapping.  

The user could then override this in the review properties when assigning reviewers/moderators if required.  Although being able to prevent this would be good too, probably as a project/repository mapping option "Allow users to chose another project instead of this default".
fields.summary: Repository mapping should force default if one-to-one match found

fields.description: See attached log file
fields.summary: Nullpointer exception when creating new review

fields.description: Allow hypens in project keys. This is highly desired by Studio for namespacing issues with JIRA
fields.summary: allow hyphens in Crucible project keys

fields.description:
URL added into a Crucible comment only recognized up to the opening bracket. For example:

http://commons.apache.org/lang/api-release/org/apache/commons/lang/math/NumberUtils.html#toInt(java.lang.String,%20int)

Crucible recognizes the URL as http://commons.apache.org/lang/api-release/org/apache/commons/lang/math/NumberUtils.html#toInt
fields.summary: URL recognition in Crucible comment does not always match whole string

fields.description:
At present:

1. go into review as reviewer
2. expand a file
3. click open in tab
4. click review tab
5. the tab you opened for the other file disappears

It would be nice if tabs persisted, i.e. actually behaved like tabs!
fields.summary: Make tabs on review page work like tabs
Add project to dashboard filter

fields.description:
Redo screenshot (see CRUC-199)

NB. Need to check what 'Fix Version' CRUC-199 relates to: has it been implemented already, or will the fix be held over until Crucible 1.3? (If the latter, maybe close this issue and add its contents as an item in CRUC-187 ?)
fields.summary: update 'Repositories' screenshot

fields.description:
see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-134

Where people are using automation to create reviews via the create review URL (e.g. http://fisheye:8081/cru/create?csid=236665&repo=test ) it would be good if they could specify the project.
fields.summary: Allow project to be specified on create review URL

fields.description:
see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-134

If you're creating reviews from changes in fisheye the repository can (help) choose the project this review should belong to (if the repositories don't overlap)
fields.summary: Associate multiple repositories with a project

fields.description: When you edit a project the edit form page says Repositories list, not edit project.
fields.summary: Top of project edit form says Repositories List

fields.description:
If you add change sets to a review in reverse chronological order multiple copies of a file at different revisions will be added to the review. This is not the correct operation. 

Work around is to add change sets in chronological order.
fields.summary: multiple copies of revisions added to review if you add changesets in reverse chronological order

fields.description: When a user is created, it defaults so that it notifies a user whenever a comment is added.  Since over the course of the review there may be a lot of comments added over a short period, it would be nice if this setting defaulted to off so that users didn't get so many messages from Crucible.
fields.summary: Make default notification settings less spamy
